comment.shortText:
Causes a circular wipe animation to close around the screen.
This can be used to cover the grid portal while transitioning between scenes.
Returns a promise that resolves when the animation has finished running.
The promise will throw an exception if [`os.openCircleWipe(options)`](ref:os.openCircleWipe) is called while the animation is running.
the options that should be used for the effect.

Causes a circular wipe animation to close around the screen.
This can be used to cover the grid portal while transitioning between scenes.
Returns a promise that resolves when the animation has finished running.
The promise will throw an exception if {@link os.openCircleWipe} is called while the animation is running.

Causes the circular wipe animation to open around the screen.
This can be used to reveal the grid portal after transitioning between screens.
Returns a promise that resolves when the animation has finished running.
The promise will throw an exception if [`os.closeCircleWipe(options)`](ref:os.closeCircleWipe) is called while the animation is running.
the options that should be used for the effect.

Causes the circular wipe animation to open around the screen.
This can be used to reveal the grid portal after transitioning between screens.
Returns a promise that resolves when the animation has finished running.
The promise will throw an exception if {@link os.closeCircleWipe} is called while the animation is running.
Gets the dimension that is loaded into the [`#gridPortal`](tags:gridPortal) portal.
comment.text: > This function behaves exactly like [`os.getPortalDimension(portal)`](ref:os.getPortalDimension) when given "gridPortal".

comment.shortText: Gets the dimension that is loaded into the {@tag gridPortal} portal.
comment.text: > This function behaves exactly like {@link os.getPortalDimension} when given "gridPortal".

comment.shortText: Gets the inst that is loaded.
Gets the inst that is loaded.
Gets the distance that the player bot is from the given dimension.
comment.text: Returns `0` if the player bot is in the dimension, `1` if the dimension is in a portal, and `-1` if neither are true.

comment.shortText: The dimension to check for.
Gets the distance that the player bot is from the given dimension.
comment.text: Returns `0` if the player bot is in the dimension, `1` if the dimension is in a portal, and `-1` if neither are true.

Exits fullscreen mode.
Exits fullscreen mode.
Attempts to enter fullscreen mode. Depending on which web browser the player is using, this might ask for permission to go fullscreen.
comment.text: Note that iPhones currently don't support fullscreen mode.

comment.shortText: Attempts to enter fullscreen mode. Depending on which web browser the player is using, this might ask for permission to go fullscreen.
comment.text: Note that iPhones currently don't support fullscreen mode.

comment.shortText: Loads the given dimension into the [`#gridPortal`](tags:gridPortal) portal. Triggers the [`@onPortalChanged`](tags:@onPortalChanged) shout for the gridPortal.
the dimension that should be loaded.
Loads the given dimension into the {@tag gridPortal} portal. Triggers the {@tag @onPortalChanged} shout for the gridPortal.
Redirects the current tab to the given URL. Useful for sending the player to another webpage or ambient experience.

tags.text:
Send the player to https://example.com.
os.goToURL("https://example.com");

comment.shortText: the [URL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL) that the player should be sent to. Usually this is a website like `https://example.com`.
Redirects the current tab to the given URL. Useful for sending the player to another webpage or ambient experience.

tags.text:
Send the player to https://example.com.
os.goToURL("https://example.com");

comment.shortText: Opens a new tab with the given URL. Useful for opening another webpage without redirecting the current tab.

tags.text:
Open https://example.com in a new tab.
os.openURL("https://example.com");

comment.shortText: the [URL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL) that the player should be sent to. Usually this is a website like `https://example.com`.
Opens a new tab with the given URL. Useful for opening another webpage without redirecting the current tab.

tags.text:
Open https://example.com in a new tab.
os.openURL("https://example.com");

comment.shortText: Gets the list of supported inputs. The returned strings can be used for the controller property in [`os.getInputState(controller, button)`](ref:os.getInputState) calls.
Gets the list of supported inputs. The returned strings can be used for the controller property in {@link os.getInputState} calls.
Gets the state of the given button on the given controller.

The name of the controller that should be checked.
Possible values are:

-    `mousePointer` - The mouse.
-    `leftPointer` - The left controller.
-    `rightPointer` - The right controller.
-    `keyboard` - The keyboard.
-    `touch` - The touchscreen.

the name of the button that you want to get the state of.
Possible values are:

-    `left` - The left mouse button. Only available on the mouse pointer. On mobile devices this will also be the state of the first touch.
-    `right` - The right mouse button. Only available on the mouse pointer.
-    `middle` - The middle mouse button. Only available on the mouse pointer.
-    `primary` - The primary controller button. Only available on the left and right pointers.
-    `squeeze` - The squeeze controller button. Only available on the left and right pointers.
-    `Any` Key - The button for the given key. Only available on the keyboard.
-    `0` - The first touch. Only available on the touchscreen.
-    `1` - The second touch. Only available on the touchscreen.
-    `2` - The third touch. Only available on the touchscreen.
-    `3` - The fourth touch. Only available on the touchscreen.
-    `5` - The fifth touch. Only available on the touchscreen.
Gets the state of the given button on the given controller.

comment.shortText: Disables Point-of-View mode on the device. This will return the camera to its original position, set the camera type back to what it was before, and change the camera controls to the defaults.
Disables Point-of-View mode on the device. This will return the camera to its original position, set the camera type back to what it was before, and change the camera controls to the defaults.

Enables Point-of-View mode on the device.
Useful for getting a "ground level" view in the grid portal.
This will move the camera to the given position, set the camera type to `perspective`, and change the camera controls so that dragging the screen causes the camera to look around.
comment.text: It is not possible to manually move the camera in this mode, however it is still possible to use [`os.focusOn(bot, options)`](ref:os.focusOn-bot) to move the camera.

tags.text:
Enable POV mode with the IMU.
os.enablePointOfView(undefined, true);

comment.shortText: the position that the camera should be placed at. If not specified, then the camera will be placed at `(0, 0, 0)`.
whether the imuPortal should be used to control the camera rotation while in Point-of-View mode.

Enables Point-of-View mode on the device.
Useful for getting a "ground level" view in the grid portal.
This will move the camera to the given position, set the camera type to `perspective`, and change the camera controls so that dragging the screen causes the camera to look around.
comment.text: It is not possible to manually move the camera in this mode, however it is still possible to use {@link os.focusOn-bot} to move the camera.

tags.text:
Enable POV mode with the IMU.
os.enablePointOfView(undefined, true);

comment.shortText:
Calculates the ray that starts at the given portal camera and travels along the path emanating from the given viewport position.
Returns a promise that resolves with information about the calculated ray.
the name of the portal that should be tested.

the 2D viewport position that the ray should start at.
Viewport positions locate a specific point on the image that the camera produces.
`(X: 0, Y: 0)` represents the center of the camera while `(X: -1, Y: -1)` represents the lower left corner and `(X: 1, Y: 1)` represents the upper right corner.

Calculates the ray that starts at the given portal camera and travels along the path emanating from the given viewport position.
Returns a promise that resolves with information about the calculated ray.

Finds the list of bots that are in the given portal and are intersected by a ray starting at the given origin position and traveling in the given direction.
Returns a promise that resolves with information about the intersected bots.
the name of the portal that should be tested.
the 3D position that the ray should start at.
the 3D direction that the ray should travel along.

Finds the list of bots that are in the given portal and are intersected by a ray starting at the given origin position and traveling in the given direction.
Returns a promise that resolves with information about the intersected bots.

Finds the list of bots that are in the given portal and are intersected by a ray starting at the portal camera and traveling along a path emanating from the given viewport position.
Returns a promise that resolves with information about the intersected bots.
the portal that should be tested.

the 2D viewport position that the ray should start at.
Viewport positions locate a specific point on the image that the camera produces.
`(X: 0, Y: 0)` represents the center of the camera while `(X: -1, Y: -1)` represents the lower left corner and `(X: 1, Y: 1)` represents the upper right corner.

Finds the list of bots that are in the given portal and are intersected by a ray starting at the portal camera and traveling along a path emanating from the given viewport position.
Returns a promise that resolves with information about the intersected bots.
Shows a confirmation dialog using the given options. Confirmation dialogs are useful for giving users the ability to quickly confirm or cancel an action.
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves with `true` if the user clicked the "Confirm" button and `false` if they closed the dialog or clicked the "Cancel" button.

comment.shortText: the options that should be used for the confirmation dialog.
Shows a confirmation dialog using the given options. Confirmation dialogs are useful for giving users the ability to quickly confirm or cancel an action.
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves with `true` if the user clicked the "Confirm" button and `false` if they closed the dialog or clicked the "Cancel" button.

comment.shortText: Shows an input modal with the given value and options. When shown, the player will be able to change the value.
comment.text:
Returns a Promise that resolves with the final value when the user is finished editing.
This function is similar to [`os.showInputForTag(bot, tag, options)`](ref:os.showInputForTag) except it doesn't require a bot and a tag.

comment.shortText: the value that should be shown in the input modal.
the options that indicate how the input box should be customized.
Shows an input modal with the given value and options. When shown, the player will be able to change the value.
comment.text:
Returns a Promise that resolves with the final value when the user is finished editing.
This function is similar to {@link os.showInputForTag} except it doesn't require a bot and a tag.

comment.shortText:
Shows an input modal for the given bot and tag with the given options.
When shown, the player will be able to change the value stored in the given tag.
Triggers the [`@onSaveInput`](tags:@onSaveInput) whisper when the modal is closed with saving and the [`@onCloseInput`](tags:@onCloseInput) whisper when the modal is closed without saving.

tags.text:
Show a basic text input modal for the #name tag on this bot.
os.showInputForTag(this, "name");

comment.shortText: the bot or bot ID that the input should be shown for.
the tag that should be edited on the bot.
the possible cusomization options for the input modal.

Shows an input modal for the given bot and tag with the given options.
When shown, the player will be able to change the value stored in the given tag.
Triggers the {@tag @onSaveInput} whisper when the modal is closed with saving and the {@tag @onCloseInput} whisper when the modal is closed without saving.

tags.text:
Show a basic text input modal for the #name tag on this bot.
os.showInputForTag(this, "name");

comment.shortText:
Hides the tooltips that have the specified IDs. If no arguments are specified, then all tooltips will be hidden.
Returns a promise that resolves when the tooltips have been hidden.
the tooltip ID or array of tooltip IDs that should be hidden.

Hides the tooltips that have the specified IDs. If no arguments are specified, then all tooltips will be hidden.
Returns a promise that resolves when the tooltips have been hidden.

Shows a temporary "tooltip" message on the screen. Optionally placed at the specified position and shown for the given duration.
Returns a promise that resolves with the ID of the new tooltip.
comment.text:
If a position is not specified, then a position just below the current mouse position will be used.
If on mobile, then the last touch position will be used or the center of the screen if the user has not touched the screen.
Additionally, if a position is not specified then the tooltip will be automatically hidden if the user moves the mouse significantly away from the position that the mouse was at when the tooltip was shown.

tags.text:
Show a tip at the center of the screen.
os.tip("This is in the center of the screen.", gridPortalBot.tags.pixelWidth / 2, gridPortalBot.tags.pixelHeight / 2);

Show a tip near the mouse cursor for 5 seconds.
os.tip("5 second tip.", null, null, 5);

Show a tip and record its ID in a tag mask.
masks.tipID = await os.tip("Hello!");

comment.shortText: the text that the tooltip message should show.
the horizontal pixel position that the tooltip should be shown at on the screen. If not specified then the current mouse position will be used.
the vertical position that the tooltip should be shown at on the screen. If not specified then a position just below the current mouse position will be used.
the number of seconds that the toast should be shown for before automatically being hidden. (Default is 2)

Shows a temporary "tooltip" message on the screen. Optionally placed at the specified position and shown for the given duration.
Returns a promise that resolves with the ID of the new tooltip.
comment.text:
If a position is not specified, then a position just below the current mouse position will be used.
If on mobile, then the last touch position will be used or the center of the screen if the user has not touched the screen.
Additionally, if a position is not specified then the tooltip will be automatically hidden if the user moves the mouse significantly away from the position that the mouse was at when the tooltip was shown.

tags.text:
Show a tip at the center of the screen.
os.tip("This is in the center of the screen.", gridPortalBot.tags.pixelWidth / 2, gridPortalBot.tags.pixelHeight / 2);

Show a tip near the mouse cursor for 5 seconds.
os.tip("5 second tip.", null, null, 5);

Show a tip and record its ID in a tag mask.
masks.tipID = await os.tip("Hello!");

comment.shortText: Enables "custom dragging" for the current bot drag operation.
comment.text:
Custom dragging tells CasualOS to not move the bot to the dragged position. Instead, it will calculate where the bot would be dragged and send that information in the [`@onDragging`](tags:@onDragging) and [`@onAnyBotDragging`](tags:@onAnyBotDragging) listeners.

This is useful for custom bot dragging behavior like choosing to scale or rotate a bot instead of moving it.

tags.text:
Enable custom dragging for the current drag operation
os.enableCustomDragging();

comment.shortText: Enables "custom dragging" for the current bot drag operation.
comment.text:
Custom dragging tells CasualOS to not move the bot to the dragged position. Instead, it will calculate where the bot would be dragged and send that information in the {@tag @onDragging} and {@tag @onAnyBotDragging} listeners.

This is useful for custom bot dragging behavior like choosing to scale or rotate a bot instead of moving it.

tags.text:
Enable custom dragging for the current drag operation
os.enableCustomDragging();

comment.shortText:
Focuses on the given bot. For bots in the bot or miniGridPortals, this animates the camera such that the portal focus point is placed on the given bot or position.
For input bots in menu portal, this gives keyboard focus to them.
comment.text:
Returns a promise which resolves when the bot has been focused.
For the bot and miniGridPortals this is when the animation finishes and rejects if the user takes control of the camera during the animation. For menu bots this is when the input field is focused and rejects if the bot is not a input bot.

tags.text:
Move the player's view to show a bot named bob.
await os.focusOn(getBot("#name", "bob"));

comment.shortText: the additional options to use for the focus operation. This can be used to change how the camera moves or to specify which portal the bot should be focused in.

Focuses on the given bot. For bots in the bot or miniGridPortals, this animates the camera such that the portal focus point is placed on the given bot or position.
For input bots in menu portal, this gives keyboard focus to them.
comment.text:
Returns a promise which resolves when the bot has been focused.
For the bot and miniGridPortals this is when the animation finishes and rejects if the user takes control of the camera during the animation. For menu bots this is when the input field is focused and rejects if the bot is not a input bot.

tags.text:
Move the player's view to show a bot named bob.
await os.focusOn(getBot("#name", "bob"));

comment.shortText: Focuses on the given position.
comment.text: Returns a promise which resolves when the position has been focused.

comment.shortText: the additional options to use for the focus operation. This can be used to change how the camera moves or to specify which portal the bot should be focused in.
Focuses on the given position.
comment.text: Returns a promise which resolves when the position has been focused.

comment.shortText: Replaces the bot that the user is dragging with the given bot.
comment.text: If called when the user is not dragging anything, then the given bot or mod will be dragged using the current input method. When in VR, the current input method is the most recently used VR controller. Otherwise it is the mouse/touchscreen.

comment.shortText: the bot that should be dragged. If given a bot while dragging, then that bot's [`@onDrag`](tags:@onDrag) will be skippped but [`@onDrop`](tags:@onDrop) will be called. If given a bot when not dragging, then that bot's [`@onDrag`](tags:@onDrag) and [`@onDrop`](tags:@onDrop) will be called.
Replaces the bot that the user is dragging with the given bot.
comment.text: If called when the user is not dragging anything, then the given bot or mod will be dragged using the current input method. When in VR, the current input method is the most recently used VR controller. Otherwise it is the mouse/touchscreen.
